Others: Giannis Antetokounmpo scored 20 points, had 7 rebounds, 2 assists, 2 blocks, and 1 turnover in the Milwaukee Bucks' preseason game against the Los Angeles Lakers on October 10, 2024.
Antetokounmpo's defensive play, including a rejection of LeBron James' layup, was a highlight of the game.
Bucks coach Doc Rivers kept Antetokounmpo on the bench for the entire third period, giving rookie Tyler Smith an extended run at power forward in his place.
Antetokounmpo's chemistry with superstar guard Damian Lillard was noticeably improved, with their pick-and-roll action looking smoother than last season.
Antetokounmpo's defensive versatility was evident as he defended all positions on the floor with no issues, often covering for a slow Brook Lopez against Anthony Davis.
